column2: This question and answer session was offered as part of the Teen Weekend on September 2, 2017 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

column6: Session title

column3: 2017-09-11 Teen Weekend Q&A with Luang Por.mp3

column6: Text
What meaningful impact do Buddhist monks have on the community?
Ajahn Pasanno's first visit to Wat Pah Pong.
How closely do you and the other monks live together?
Human beings. Those are beings with issues.|Ajahn Chah
When you first ordained, you were just starting to learn about Buddhism. What changed that made you want to dive in?
"If you want to stay with me, you have to stay at least five years." — Ajahn Chah
Will we get to see your kuti today?
Early history of Abhayagiri Monastery.
What was the hardest thing to give up?
Ajahn Pasanno's first visit back to Canada.

In a Latin American country, the government privatized the water supply and passed a law making it illegal to collect rainwater. Everyone had to buy their water from Nestlé. Does this count as taking what is not given?
I have doubts about the concept of personal property. How does activism following the Five Precepts work in a country whose water supply has been bought out by private interests?
Ajahn Pasanno investigates a logging operation at Dtao Dtum.
If you could give your younger self one piece of information, what would it be?
What were you like when you were 18?
I haven't heard any Buddhist teachers talk about wholesome romantic relationships.
AN 4.55 Samajīvī Sutta
Can you talk about your environmental work in Thailand? What qualities of heart and inner strength help us live without being completely overwhelmed?
Sri Lankan monastic kidney donors.
What is the most important thing we can do to help the next generation in terms of the environment?
Teen2017_S00_F13.mp3
Ajahn Pasanno teaches communication skills to Thai villagers.
What are the biggest misconceptions about being ordained?
Teen2017_S00_F15.mp3
Ajahn Pasanno visits Ajahn Buddhadāsa: "Don't be selfish!"
What was your greatest desire as a kid?
Are there monastics who wander around the world without any home base or destination?
Have you broken any precepts where only you know if you broke them?
Ajahn Pasanno's uncle offers him alcohol.
For the sake of the precepts, what's the definition of gossip?
Does gossip include talking about someone who is not present for entertainment value?
Is the point of the precepts to create as much well-being and as little pain in your environment as possible?
Is the philosophy of this community totally against fun?
Some of the things that monastics avoid due to their precepts can be really beautiful.
Apart from cheating in a relationship or sexual assault, what is sexual misconduct?
When all of the solar panels will be put in, how much of the monastery's energy needs will be met?
When's your birthday?
Do the monks give each other massages?
What do you think of our president right now?
What precepts don't most people know about that have a big effect on your life?
Do monastics talk with each other about the precepts they have broken or having wrong thoughts?
